column4: where am I supposed to install the themes/icons/window borders/etc that I've saved from art.gnome.org?
in your settings panel
guys, what p2p programs work wonders for you in alternative to Frostwire??
I went to the settings panel and I could not see them. was I not supposed to extract them?
i use Transmission yet but  i mean an alternative to Frostwire, so a direct connection program
ok... when you're there, click on appearance
and you're done

i'm not sure you understood the nature of my question. i know how to change themes and what not. but installing it is a bit different. for one, i don't even know WHERE i'm supposed to put the themes i saved. lol
i didn't save theme packages. that would probably have been easier. i just have random window borders, random single themes, icons..
sorry. then, when you're on the appearance box, just drag and drop the file you saved from gnome art
oooh, i see.
you are the man!
oh another thing..
if something goes wrong with the drag and drop, try changing the format of the folder your themes are compressed in, ok?
for exemple.. .tar , .tar.bz , .tar.gz
do you know some alternative program to Frostwire?
actually i've already taken the liberty of extracting 'em.
oh ok
quite honestly i have never heard of frostwire. i use edonkey myself.
is it quite fast?
it is.
definetely is.
ok, thank you very much for your help:)
